content: mug cozy trifecta by @asawki_knits c a b this pattern includes three charts for three di8erent mug cozy patterns charts a b and c the mug cozies are knit flat on 4 5mm needles and only require 12-18 grams of worsted weight yarn there is no gauge swatch necessary because the project can be measured against your mug of choice to ensure good fit to adjust the fit you can go up or down a needle size alternatively you could add or reduce the number of edge stitches in the garter edge of the mug cozy materials 1 suggested yarn 12-18g knitpicks wool of the andes in shade cloud a8iliate link i love making free patterns if you are able please support my work as a designer by making your next knitpicks purchase through my a>iliate link 2 small button needles 4 5mm us size 7 straight or circular notions tapestry needle scissors cable needle abbreviated terms k = knit p = purl co = cast on sts = stitches slip_stitch = slip_stitch cast on 1 co 18 chart a 18 chart b 17 chart c sts using longtail cast on main body following chart 2 row 1 ws k1 row 3 row 2 rs sl 1 st knitwise k until yo and k2tog this produces the buttonhole then k until end of row a note all row after row 1 begin with sl 1 st knitwise in order to produce a clean and tight edge 4 row 3 ws and 4 rs sl 1 st knitwise k to end of row 5 begin cable chart and repeat row marked in between red lines as many times as needed to fit around the circumference of your mug if you end up with a half or portion of a repeat that s okay but end with a ws row 6 when ¼ in away from fitting around the edge of your mug start the final 4 row of garter 7 cast o8 as you complete final row finishing 8 cut yarn and use cast-on and cast-o8 tails to join the upper two corners and lower two corners 9 weave in all ends and sew on a small button in the center of the final row chart a 2/1 rpc 2/1 lpc 2/2 lc * yarn over + rs knit 2 together ws purl 2 together chart a -
